group_1.textLeft: Alright, we’re going over our plans for the movie.

group_1.textRight: Who put you in charge?

group_1.textLeft: Kaede and I made the group, so it's only natural.
Anyway, here's the plan...

group_1.narration: "Submit your results through our app@and win phenomenal prizes!"
"The only must-haves are that the movie features@six students and a summer-related theme."

group_1.textLeft: Since our sixth member isn't here, we're gonna@have to ask someone else we know to fill in.
We'll shoot the movie tomorrow. That okay with@you guys?

group_1.textRight: Mm, I don't think we should do it right away.

group_1.textLeft: Why not?

group_1.textRight: From what I understand,
Filmmakers are supposed to put together a@storyboard,
And scout an appropriate location before@anything else.

group_1.textLeft: What's a storyboard?

group_1.textRight: Basically, it's a written or visual summary of the@imagery and scenes of a movie.
Filmmakers use them to map out their plot.
Then, using that storyboard,
They visit different places to pick out the right@locations for their movie,
And make a list of props they might need.

group_1.textLeft: I see. So we’ll need to visit the location in advance@in order to film efficiently.
I'm learning quite a bit.

group_1.textRight: *Giggle* Well, what can I say? I've been doing@my research.
Of course, Miss Minami here must know all of@this already, right?

group_1.textLeft: Erm...

group_1.textRight: Ah... we, um, actually didn't do all that much@research...

group_1.textLeft: Dammit, Kaede...

group_1.textRight: Excuse me? You're the leader, but you didn't@prepare at all?

group_1.textLeft: [chara:100901:effect_emotion_angry_0][se:7219_strain]Nnh..!

group_1.textRight: W-we’re really sorry...!
...It's the first time any of us have made a movie.
Why don't we decide on our overarching theme@before we get too deep in the technical details?
I think knowing our goal for the movie can help@us lock down what we want it to look like.

group_1.textLeft: Y-yeah, exactly! We're all just beginners here.
So there's no point in acting like you know@everything, is there?

group_1.textRight: Rrr...!
...Sooo, what exactly does "deciding on a theme"@mean?

group_1.textLeft: It's like...the direction of a work, basically.
Oh yeah, and we need it to be original, because@it looks like that's critical to getting a high rating.

group_1.textRight: If you want a theme that hasn't been used by@other movies,
Why don't we watch what's already been@submitted?
Oh, that's a good idea!

group_1.textLeft: Hmm... Most of them are prank videos or short@gag clips.

group_1.textRight: If I had to pick a common theme, I’d say they’re@all comedies.

group_1.textLeft: But none of them are really about summer,@you know?
So before we get too ahead of ourselves,
We have to figure out what things are most@associated with summer…

group_1.textRight: Um... well... swimsuits, I guess...?

group_1.textLeft: Ice cream, obviously!

group_1.textRight: I suppose fireworks as well.

group_1.textCenter: Yeah... all of those things are definitely big parts@of summer.
I have no idea how to fit them all into one movie,@though...

group_1.textRight: What is it?

group_1.textLeft: I think I've got it... I know exactly what we should@do for the movie, and the perfect place to film it!
We're gonna make a beachside drama!

group_1.textRight: A drama...?

group_1.textLeft: Yeah! If we make the movie at the beach,@that's the essence of summer right there.
And if we use the storyboarding techniques,
That Kasane and Kirari were looking at, we can@make a great story, no?

group_1.textRight: ...Well, that could be possible.
Still... coming up with a plot is very difficult.

group_1.textLeft: Taking in the setting will probably give us@inspiration for what we should do.

group_1.textRight: Ah, so we'll be doing some on-site work!

group_1.textLeft: Yeah... Tomorrow, we're all going to the beach!
